label: Piglet
description: A piglet is a young pig. esp. a suckling of age upto 3 and 4 weeks.

label: Weaner
description: The stage that comes after lactation (after the weaning event), in which the piglets are taken away from their dam and normally proceed to eat only solid food (compound feed) and water. It normally lasts 7-8 weeks and the animals can grow approximately 20-25 kg during this stage.

label: Grower
description: A pig between weaning and sale or transfer to the breeding herd, sold for slaughter or killed for rations.

label: Finisher
description: A grower pig over 70 kg (150 lb) liveweight.

label: Sow
description: A breeding female pig, or A female pig after first or second litter.

label: Boar
description: A male pig of breeding age. Aslo known as hog

label: Fever
description: Fever means a high body temperature of 39-40?C (103-109?F). It may occur with little or no other signs or be part of a specific disease.

label: Dehydration
description: Excessive loss of body water. It occurs when free water loss exceeds free water intake, usually due to disease, or high environmental temperature.

label: Dullness
description: Lack of activeness in the animals.

label: Jaundice
description: Jaundice is a yellowing of the skin and mucous membranes due to the breakdown of red cells in the blood, the accumulation of the bye-products in the liver and the production of a substance called bilirubin. The condition may be seen at any age but is usually confined to individual animals or litter mates.
